abstract: Unlike the Charlie Sheen meltdown, the criticisms of the show by the actor Angus T. Jones — he called it “filth” in a video — are not expected to threaten its future. On Tuesday night, he issued an apology.
snippet: Unlike the Charlie Sheen meltdown, the criticisms of the show by the actor Angus T. Jones — he called it “filth” in a video — are not expected to threaten its future. On Tuesday night, he issued an apology.
lead_paragraph: 7:55 a.m. | Updated The fate of the CBS comedy “Two and a Half Men” may not ride on any future decisions by Angus T. Jones, the young co-star who this week appeared in a video where he denounced the show as filth and urged viewers not to watch it.

headline.main: Another Star Lashes Out, and ‘Two and a Half Men’ Keeps Cruising
